title.value: Рост длиннопалого рака (Astacus leptodactylus) в искусственном водоеме в течение первых трех вегетационных сезонов
Growth of narrow-clawed crayfish (Astacus leptodactylus) in artificial basin during the first three growing seasons

journal.title: Proceedings of the National Academy of Sciences of Belarus. Biological Series

person.name: Nikiforov, M.E., National Academy of Sciences (Belarus). The Scientific and Practical Center for Bioresources

abstract.value: Narrow-clawed crayfish (Astacus leptodactylus) appears one of the most popular fishing invertebrate animals of the Republic of Belarus possessing delicious meat and high recreation value. For organization of rational fishing and determination of the norms of permissible catches of narrow-clawed crayfish it is necessary to evaluate the age structure of crayfish populations. Therefore, the main goal of the research appears evaluation of the growth and development of narrow-clawed crayfish during 3 vegetation seasons from the hatching of larvae up to the 2+ age. The growth and development of narrow-clawed crayfish (Astacus leptodactylus) has been researched during three seasons in a concrete water reservoir. Length and mass of the crayfish species of the age 0+, 1+ and 2+ is analyzed; average sizes and viability of the fingerlings of narrow-clawed crayfish in the end of vegetation period during pond growing are evaluated. The average size of individuals of age 0+ is approximately 2,7 cm; of age 1+ is 4,8 cm and of age of 2+ 7,4 cm.
